Name: Prohibiting general vending from vehicles.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting general vending from vehicles.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1.  Subsection o of section 20-455 of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended to read as follows:
o.  No general vendor shall sell [or], offer for sale or display any item directly from any parked or double parked motor vehicle[.], including the roof, hood and/or trunk of the vehicle, nor shall any general vendor display commercial signage, whether affixed to a vehicle or not, advertising or pertaining to items located on or inside any parked or double parked vehicle.  No general vendor shall permit a customer or potential customer to enter a vehicle for the purposes of vending an item from said vehicle.   
Â§2.  This local law shall take effect immediately.

4/10/08
